N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 255.753 - Caulked bell and spigot joints

State Regulations
(a) Each cast iron caulked bell and spigot joint that is subject to pressures of 25
psig (172 kPa) or more must be sealed with a material or device which: (1)
does not reduce the flexibility of the
joint; (2)
permanently bonds, either chemically, mechanically or both, with the bell and spigot metal
surfaces or adjacent pipe metal surfaces; and
(3)
seals and bonds in a manner that meets
the strength, environmental, and chemical compatibility requirements of
sections
255.53
(a)-(b)
and
255.143
of this Part. (b) Each cast iron caulked bell
and spigot joint that is exposed for any reason, must be sealed by a means
other than caulking. Notes
